ygData.subject: Re: ContentTypeRegExFilter
ygData.msgSnippet: It surprised me too, but I was feeding it a .au domain, and it wouldn t crawl anything until I removed au from the exclusion list. Here s the crawl log entry:

It surprised me too, but I was feeding it a .au domain, and it
wouldn't crawl anything until I removed au from the exclusion list.

Here's the crawl log entry:
20041206201135862   -63          -
http://www.goldendragonpalace.com.au/ - - no-type #001 - - -

As soon as I remove "au" from the filter regexp heritrix crawls the
site correctly.  I tried adding a trailing "/" to the URL in my seed
list, same result.

Rob.
--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Tom Emerson <Tree@b...> wrote:
> robeger writes:
> > FYI, you have "au" as one of your extensions, which causes problems if
> > you are crawling any sites in Australia (.au domain).  Caused me some
> > frustrations until I figured out what was going on.  Haven't looked
> > through the list to see if there are any other top level domains
in there.
> 
> I'm surprised this is being applied against the domains --- the filter
> should only be applied against the end of a full-qualified URL, so
> even a TLD should have a '/' at the end which would preclude this
> regex from matching.
> 
>     -tree
> 
> -- 
> Tom Emerson                                          Basis
Technology Corp.
